headline: Fellow at Code for America

values.summary:
Inaugural class of 2011 Code for America Fellows

In the inaugural class of 2011 Code for America Fellows 361 people applied and 20 were chosen as the first class of fellows.

Over this past year I have had a chance to work on a wide arrange of projects.  I spent the month of February learning about the City of Boston which also includes Boston Public Schools, Boston Public Library as well as the after school programs.  

I also worked on different open source applications such as creating Ruby gems for different government APIs.  Part of my time spent here was working on a Solar Widget for the ArcGIS Flex viewer which determines solar power for a rooftop.
values.title: Fellow

values.summary:
At the City of Santa Clarita increasing responsibility over the years starting from an IT Specialist moving to an IT Analyst and then Senior IT Analyst.

As a Senior IT Analyst my primary role was the Application Development manager which was responsible for management and oversight of Application Development Staff as well as all software implementation in the City of Santa Clarita.

Application Development was responsible for development, implementation, and project management of new software applications.  Application Development was also responsible for coordination and overseeing software installations, training and support.  All applications were developed using the Microsoft .NET Framework with Microsoft SQL and Windows Server running IIS.

I was also responsible for administration and management of City's databases and SQL database servers. Management of City's suite of Internet sites and City's intranet.

Design and development of eGraffiti application, City-wide graffiti tracking database. Recognized by the League of California Cities as a 2007 Grand Prize Helen Putnam Award Winner.
values.title: Senior Information Technology Analyst

summary:
I have a Masters in Public Administration (MPA) and Bachelors of Science in Computer Science from California State University Northridge (CSUN).

I am currently part of the inaugural class of Code for America Fellows.  Code for America is a non profit technology startup based in San Francisco that brings top web professionals to give a year of service building web 2.0 apps for local governments.  Over this past year I have worked on many open source projects including creating Ruby Gems and ArcGIS applications.  

Prior to Code for America I worked for the City of Santa Clarita as a Senior Information Technology Analyst in the division of Technology Services.  I have over 5+ years of experience developing local government applications and management in the Information Technology sector of local government.  I began working at the City of Santa Clarita as an Application Development Contractor and moved with increasing responsibility each year from IT Specialist, IT Analyst and Senior IT Analyst.

I have a wide variety of experience developing applications for local government.  This includes land use management software, permitting software, ArcGIS mapping and various other local government applications. I am very active in the Government 2.0 space and follow all trends and practices
